greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(rad(n), n/rad(n)), where rad(n) = A007947(n) is the squarefree kernel of n.
comment: Product of primes dividing n more than once. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 08 2013
Squarefree kernel of the square part of n. - _Peter Munn_, Jun 12 2020
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with p^e -> p^ceiling((e-1)/e), p prime.
a(n) = rad(n/rad(n)) = A007947(A003557(n)). - observed by _Velin Yanev_, Aug 20 2017, confirmed by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 28 2017
mathematica: Table[With[{r = Apply[Times, FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]]}, GCD[r, n/r]], {n, 104}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 20 2017 *)
program: (Scheme, with memoization-macro definec) (definec (A071773 n) (if (= 1 n) n (* (if (zero? (modulo n (expt (A020639 n) 2))) (A020639 n) 1) (A071773 (A028234 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 28 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 24 2002
